# schedule(id:configuration:)

**Instance Method**

Schedules a new alarm.

## Declaration

```swift
func schedule<Metadata>(id: Alarm.ID, configuration: AlarmManager.AlarmConfiguration<Metadata>) async throws -> Alarm where Metadata : AlarmMetadata
```

## Parameters

- **id**: The alarmâ€™s identifier.
- **configuration**: The configuration for the new alarm.

## Discussion

If scheduling a new alarm is successful, the function returns the [doc://com.apple.alarmkit/documentation/AlarmKit/Alarm] structure. If you provide a [doc://com.apple.alarmkit/documentation/AlarmKit/Alarm/countdownDuration-swift.property], the system shows a countdown UI for the specified duration before the alarm alerts. If you provide a `schedule`, the alarm alerts at the scheduled time. If you provide both a `countdownDuration` and a [doc://com.apple.alarmkit/documentation/AlarmKit/Alarm/schedule-swift.property], the system shows a countdown UI before the alarm alerts, possibly on a repeating schedule. Define the ID to encode it into your intent.

## Scheduling an alarm

- **AlarmManager.AlarmConfiguration**: An object that contains all the properties necessary to schedule an alarm.
